title: Last known speaker fights to preserve South African indigenous language
text: N|uu was spoken by one of many hunter-gatherer groups that populated Southern Africa before the arrival of European colonizers.

title: More than half of the world's large lakes are drying up
text: Report shows the world's most important freshwater sources lost water at a cumulative rate of around 22 gigatons per year for nearly three decades.

title: Pentagon accounting error overvalued Ukraine weapons aid by $3 billion, sources say
text: The error was the result of assigning a higher than warranted value on weaponry that was taken from U.S. stocks and then shipped to Ukraine.

title: At the G7 summit in Hiroshima, all eyes will be on ‘Ukraine, Ukraine, Ukraine’
text: Discussions on the issue will come at a crucial time for the G7 grouping itself, which has struggled to define its purpose and goals in recent years, as well as for the host country.

title: Next five years to be hottest ever, likely crossing 1.5 C for a year, says WMO
text: Report marks the first time the agency has forecast warming beyond the 1.5 C threshold for at least twelve months as the most likely scenario.

title: More nations plan for 'health disasters' fueled by climate change
text: The health argument for climate action can be very powerful, and can be the one that might motivate governments.

title: Icy northern U.S. city becomes haven for climate migrants
text: Despite its tough environment, Duluth in Minnesota is starting to make a name for itself as a refuge of sorts — for those fleeing global warming.

title: A billion new air conditioners will save lives but cook the planet
text: Demand for air conditioners is surging in markets where both incomes and temperatures are rising, such as India, China, Indonesia and the Philippines.

title: Global executions highest in five years, Amnesty International says
text: Egypt, Iran and Saudi Arabia carried out 90% of the executions recorded last year, the rights group said. The numbers did not include China, it said, citing a lack of transparency.

title: In first, Kyiv says it shot down volley of Russian hypersonic missiles
text: When asked about the Ukrainian claim, Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu dismissed it, the RIA news agency reported.

title: Putin’s war revives Russia’s dark tradition of informers
text: The informers are a reflection of the sweeping changes the invasion has brought to Russia, seeking to eradicate once-tolerated hints of opposition.

title: Elon Musk documents subpoenaed in Jeffrey Epstein lawsuit by U.S. Virgin Islands
text: The subpoena came to light in a request by the Virgin Islands to serve Musk by alternative means because it had been unable to locate and serve him.

title: New threat to privacy? Scientists sound alarm about DNA tool
text: The tool could lead to a range of scientific advances but it also poses a vast range of concerns around consent, privacy and surveillance.

title: Ukraine hails first gains in six months as Zelenskyy secures drones from U.K.
text: Since last week, the Ukrainian military has started to push Russian forces back in and around the embattled city of Bakhmut, its first significant offensive operations since November.

title: How Turkey's election went wrong for Erdogan's rival
text: Neither candidate's ability to break the 50% threshold sets up a historic May 28 runoff — Turkey's first — that Erdogan enters as the strong favorite.

title: Communities torn as Ukraine turns its back on Moscow-linked church
text: Tensions have surfaced in villages across Ukraine as authorities have cracked down on the Ukrainian Orthodox Church.

title: Sustainable food — not more of it — needed as global hunger soars
text: Farmers today grow sufficient crops to feed twice the current population — but but nearly a third of food produced globally is spoiled or thrown away.

title: Germany is experiencing a mass worker shortage. Can migration fix it?
text: About 320,000 more people will reach retirement age this year than become adults, meaning the German economy will lose workers while also having to pay more for pensions.

title: G7 leaders to target Russian energy and trade in new sanctions steps
text: Separately, U.S. officials expect G7 members will agree to adjust their approach to sanctions so that, at least for certain categories of goods, all exports are automatically banned.

title: Turkey faces runoff election with Erdogan leading
text: With almost 97% of ballot boxes counted, Erdogan led with 49.39% of votes and rival Kemal Kilicdaroglu had 44.92%, according to state-owned news agency Anadolu.

title: Posing as Islamists, Russian hackers take aim at Sweden
text: A series of coordinated cyberattacks by suspected Russian hackers intended to jeopardize Sweden's chances of joining NATO have been disrupting its biggest companies.

title: U.S. Congress and White House begin tough debt limit and budget negotiations
text: Time is tight to avoid a historic, economically destabilizing default on government debt, which the Treasury Department has warned could come as soon as June 1.

title: Human pangenome ushers in 'new age of genetic diagnosis'
text: Scientists hope that the more diverse and accurate DNA blueprint for our species will help shed light on a range of diseases.

title: Mammograms should start at 40, U.S. task force says
text: Breast cancer is the second-most common cancer and the second-most common cause of cancer death for women in the United States.

title: China woos European leaders on trip overshadowed by Kremlin ties
text: As the European Union considers sanctions aimed at companies that supply Russia through third countries, China's top envoy warned against imposing sanctions on Chinese firms.

title: U.S. opens embassy in Tonga in fresh pushback against China in Pacific
text: Earlier this year, Washington reopened its embassy in the Solomon Islands after a 30-year absence.

title: Trump liable for sexually abusing writer and faces $5 million damages
text: The jurors rejected E. Jean Carroll's accusation of rape but upheld her other complaints in the closely watched civil trial following less than three hours of deliberations.

title: Biden indicates he could cancel Japan G7 trip if debt ceiling not resolved
text: Biden told reporters he is "still committed" to attending the G7 but called the debt limit impasse "the single most important thing on the agenda."

title: Former Pakistan leader Imran Khan arrested as aides call for nationwide protest
text: Khan, a former cricket star, was apparently detained in connection with a corruption investigation involving a plot of land.

title: Putin touts 'sacred' battle with West in Ukraine as Russia marks pared back Victory Day
text: The Russian leader has repeatedly likened the war in Ukraine to the challenges Moscow faced when Adolf Hitler invaded the Soviet Union in 1941.

title: Drugs developed to treat diabetes may offer new approach against Alzheimer's
text: Experts hope that by improving glucose metabolism, and tamping down inflammation in the entire body, they can slow progression of diseases like Alzheimer's and Parkinson's.

title: Phasing out fossil fuels hasn’t worked. Europe has a new idea for COP28
text: Some climate hawks have called for an expansion of renewables, rather than carbon capture technology that leaves the door open for more emissions.

title: Russia to mark Victory Day under shadow of Ukraine setbacks
text: In a major coup for the Kremlin, at least six post-Soviet leaders are expected to attend the military parade, which fetes the Soviet Union's victory over Nazi Germany in 1945.

title: Zelenskyy arrives in Germany as Ukraine prepares counteroffensive
text: Ukraine's president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, held talks Sunday with his German counterpart at the start of his first visit to Germany since Russia's invasion.

title: Ukraine’s offensive could set stage for diplomacy with Russia, U.S. officials say
text: It is unclear how the officials will define success in the counteroffensive, which could last many months, or how its outcome might affect their approach.

title: Ukraine’s advances near Bakhmut expose rifts in Russian forces
text: Russia’s pro-war bloggers were quick to claim that Ukraine’s long-anticipated counteroffensive had begun, but Ukrainian officials downplayed the advances.

title: South Africa rejects U.S. accusations of arms shipment to Russia
text: South Africa is one of Russia's most important allies on a continent divided over the Ukraine war, but says it is impartial and has abstained from voting on U.N. resolutions on the conflict.

title: Europe needs stronger line on China ties, ministers urge
text: The European Union must unite around a stronger stance toward China as it tries to cope with Beijing’s rising power, several of the bloc’s foreign ministers said.

title: Families of those lost to COVID wrestle with mixed emotions as emergency ends
text: More than 1.1 million Americans have died of COVID-19. The official end to the health emergency is being felt in complicated ways for those affected most acutely.

title: Ukraine prepares to strike back, with over $30 billion arsenal from allies
text: Kyiv’s troops will leverage their new hardware to try to overrun dug-in Russian positions and retake occupied territory, but whether it will be enough remains unclear.

title: Biden’s debt ceiling meeting with McCarthy pushed to next week
text: The delay likely signals that staff-level talks on energy permitting reform and government spending have yielded progress.

title: Mpox no longer a global health emergency, WHO chief says
text: A cousin of the smallpox virus, mpox has mostly been confined to developing countries for years, but spread across Europe and the U.S. last year.

title: Turkey's Erdogan, master campaigner, faces toughest contest yet
text: Uncertainty, anxiety and tension over what the results might hold for Europe's second-biggest country of 85 million people can be felt on the streets.

title: Trump jokes about sexual abuse verdict, repeats election falsehoods
text: An unrepentant Donald Trump held firm to past grievances at the first televised town hall of the 2024 U.S. presidential election.

title: Europe battling punishing drought and unpredictable weather forecast for 2043
text: The continent has warmed nearly twice as fast as the rest of the world over the last three decades, according to the World Meteorological Organization.
